clinical_study.brief_title: Infrared Thermography Associated With Cutaneous Microcirculation for Detection of Brown-adipose Tissue (MICROBAT)
clinical_study.official_title: Infrared Thermography Associated With Cutaneous Microcirculation for Detection of Brown-adipose Tissue: Proof of Concept Against PET-CT in Patients Affected by Pheochomocytoma and/or Paraganglioma

brief_summary.textblock: Patients affected by pheochromocytoma (PHEO) have brown-adipose tissue (BAT) hyperactivation. They perform, in routine settings, a FDG PET-CT scan. The high metabolic activity of BAT and its ability to consume both glucose and fatty acid suggest that it may have potential as a therapeutic target in the treatment of obesity. However, alternative non-invasive techniques to PET-CT BAT detection still need more validation. Accordingly, our aim will be to measure the temperature and microcirculation of the skin overlaying BAT depots in the region of FDG-uptake detected by 18F-FDG PET/CT before and after a cold test in PHEO patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
Objectives and Methodology:
- To analyse the change in temperature and microcirculation of the skin overlaying BAT depots in the region of FDG-uptake detected by 18F-FDG PET/CT before and after a cold test in PHEO patients.
- To check the decreased temperature and microcirculatory response after a cold test following resection of the tumor
All the patients affected by will benefit from a:
- clinical: treatments
- biological evaluations: glycemia, triglycerides, total cholesterol, HDL-C, LDL-C, plasma epinephrine and norepinephrine, urine catecholamine
- cutaneous microcirculation by means of Laser Speckle Imaging will be recorded at rest and during a cold test in the supra-clavicular region
- cutaneous microcirculation by means of Laser Doppler Flowmetry will be recorded at rest and during a cold test with one probe in the supra-clavicular region and one probe in umbilical region
- skin temperature by means of infrared thermography will be recorded at rest and during a cold test in the supra-clavicular region
Patients who will have surgery will be investigated before and after one year following resection of the tumor.

primary_outcome.measure: Skin temperature in supra-clavicular region in basal condition (TSCRbasal)
primary_outcome.description: Skin temperature in supra-clavicular region will be recorded by infrared thermography (FLIR camera) in basal condition

primary_outcome.measure: Skin temperature in supra-clavicular region during a cold test (TSCRcold)
primary_outcome.description: Skin temperature in supra-clavicular region will be recorded by infrared thermography (FLIR camera) during a cold test (feet in water at 19°C during 20min)

primary_outcome.measure: Baseline difference in skin temperature in supra-clavicular region (diff TSCR)

secondary_outcome.measure: Cutaneous blood flow in supra-clavicular region in basal condition (PUbasal)
secondary_outcome.description: Cutaneous blood flow in supra-clavicular region will be recorded by Laser Speckle Imaging (PeriCam) in basal condition

secondary_outcome.measure: Cutaneous blood flow in supra-clavicular region during a cold test (PUcold)
secondary_outcome.description: Cutaneous blood flow in supra-clavicular region will be recorded by Laser Speckle Imaging (PeriCam) during a cold test (feet in water at 19°C during 20min)

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline difference in cutaneous blood flow in supra-clavicular region (∆PU)
Volume of Brown Adipose Tissue detected by PET-CT
secondary_outcome.description: 18FDG PET-CT will be performed and volume will be segmented by PET/CT Viewer..

secondary_outcome.measure: Activity of Brown Adipose Tissue detected by PET-CT
secondary_outcome.description: 18FDG PET-CT will be performed and BAT activity (Standardized Uptake Value (SUV) will be segmented by PET/CT Viewer..

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline difference in skin temperature in supra-clavicular region ( ∆ diffTSCR) at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: ∆ diff TSCR = diff TSCR(month12) - diff TSCR (day0)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline difference in cutaneous blood flow in supra-clavicular region ( ∆ diff PU) at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: ∆ diff PU = diff PU (month12) - diff PU (day0)

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume of Brown Adipose Tissue detected by PET-CT
secondary_outcome.description: 18FDG PET-CT will be performed and volume will be segmented by PET/CT Viewer..

secondary_outcome.measure: Activity of Brown Adipose Tissue detected by PET-CT
secondary_outcome.description: 18FDG PET-CT will be performed and BAT activity (Standardized Uptake Value (SUV) will be segmented by PET/CT Viewer..

arm_group.description: Patients will be divided in two groups for statistical analysis: patients with detectable BAT by PET-CT (BAT+) patients with no detectable BAT by PET-CT (BAT-)

intervention.description: measurement of temperature and microcirculation of the skin overlaying BAT depots in the region of FDG-uptake detected by 18F-FDG PET/CT before and after a cold test

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with confirmed pheochromocytoma and/or paraganglioma
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnant woman
- breastfeeding woman
